sentence.english: She isn't walking across the bridge today.
sentence.spanish: Ella no camina a través del puente hoy.

sentence.english: Are they walking along the river every morning?
sentence.spanish: ¿Caminan a lo largo del río cada mañana?

sentence.english: He was driving around the city yesterday.
sentence.spanish: Él conducía alrededor de la ciudad ayer.

sentence.english: I'm not hiding behind the tree.
sentence.spanish: No me escondo detrás del árbol.

sentence.english: Were you walking down the hill slowly?
They are travelling from London to Paris.
sentence.spanish: Ellos viajan desde Londres a París.

sentence.english: Does he always park in front of the building?
sentence.spanish: ¿Aparca él siempre en frente del edificio?

sentence.english: She wasn't going into the dark room.
sentence.spanish: Ella no entraba dentro de la habitación oscura.

sentence.english: Are we getting off at the next stop?
He doesn't jump onto the moving train.
sentence.spanish: Él no salta sobre el tren en movimiento.

sentence.english: I was running out of the burning building.
sentence.spanish: Yo corría fuera del edificio en llamas.

sentence.english: Does she look over the documents carefully?
sentence.spanish: ¿Revisa ella los documentos sobre la mesa cuidadosamente?

sentence.english: They weren't driving past the old school.
sentence.spanish: Ellos no conducían pasado la vieja escuela.

sentence.english: She is going to the market every Saturday.
sentence.spanish: Ella va al mercado cada sábado.

sentence.english: Are you walking towards the city centre?
sentence.spanish: ¿Caminas hacia el centro de la ciudad?

sentence.english: He doesn't walk through the park at night.
sentence.spanish: Él no camina a través del parque por la noche.

sentence.english: Were they sitting under the tree for shade?
sentence.spanish: ¿Estaban sentados debajo del árbol para tener sombra?

sentence.english: Is she climbing up the mountain slowly?
sentence.spanish: ¿Está escalando arriba de la montaña lentamente?
